lead_paragraph: Neither a borrower nor a lender be -- and definitely don't try selling a rare first edition of Shakespeare's plays on the sly. Raymond Scott, an unemployed antiques dealer, found this out the hard way when a British court on Monday sent him to jail for eight years for handling stolen goods, The Guardian reported.
snippet: Raymond Scott was sent to prison for eight years after attempting to sell a 387-year-old collection to the Folger Shakespeare Library in Washington.

headline.main: Smuggler of Rare Shakespeare Folio Is Sentenced to Prison

abstract: Raymond Scott was sent to prison for eight years after attempting to sell a 387-year-old collection to the Folger Shakespeare Library in Washington.
